sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Gaussian elimination
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using Gaussian elimination method:

2x + 3y - 4z = 7

3x - 2y + 6z = -8

x + 5y + 2z = -3
message_2:
First, we will write the given system of linear equations in the form of an augmented matrix:

```
[ 2  3 -4 |  7 ]
[ 3 -2  6 | -8 ]
[ 1  5  2 | -3 ]
```

Step 1: Swap Row 1 and Row 3 to have 1 as the first element:

```
[ 1  5  2 | -3 ]
[ 3 -2  6 | -8 ]
[ 2  3 -4 |  7 ]
```

Step 2: Eliminate the first element of Row 2 and Row 3 by subtracting multiples of Row 1:

Row 2 = Row 2 - 3 * Row 1:
```
[ 1  5  2 | -3 ]
[ 0 -17  0 |  1 ]
[ 2  3 -4 |  7 ]
```

Row 3 = Row 3 - 2 * Row 1:
```
[ 1  5  2 | -3 ]
[ 0 -17  0 |  1 ]
[ 0 -7 -8 | 13 ]
```

Step 3: Divide Row 2 by -17 to get 1 as the second element of Row 2:

```
[ 1  5  2 | -3 ]
[ 0  1  0 | -1/17 ]
[ 0 -7 -8 | 13 ]
```

Step 4: Eliminate the second element of Row 1 and Row 3 by adding multiples of Row 2:

Row 1 = Row 1 - 5 * Row 2:
```
[ 1  0  2 | -8/17 ]
[ 0  1  0 | -1/17 ]
[ 0 -7 -8 | 13 ]
```

Row 3 = Row 3 + 7 * Row 2:
```
[ 1  0  2 | -8/17 ]
[ 0  1  0 | -1/17 ]
[ 0  0 -8 |  6 ]
```

Step 5: Divide Row 3 by -8 to get 1 as the third element of Row 3:

```
[ 1  0  2 | -8/17 ]
[ 0  1  0 | -1/17 ]
[ 0  0  1 | -3/4 ]
```

Step 6: Eliminate the third element of Row 1 by subtracting 2 * Row 3:

Row 1 = Row 1 - 2 * Row 3:
```
[ 1  0  0 |  1/17 ]
[ 0  1  0 | -1/17 ]
[ 0  0  1 | -3/4 ]
```

Now, we have the matrix in row-echelon form, and we can read the solution directly:

x = 1/17
y = -1/17
z = -3/4
